docs.snippet: The Rev. Faith Green Timmons came over to Mr. Trump during his address before the Bethel United Methodist Church in Michigan and asked that he “not make a political speech.”

headline.main: Donald Trump, Interrupted. He Calls Flint Pastor Who Cut In ‘a Nervous Mess.’

docs.snippet: In “Vintage Black Glamour: Gentlemen’s Quarters,” Nichelle Gainer explores how prominent and accomplished black men shaped their image through personal style, taking charge of how they were seen to defy stereotypes.

headline.main: Black Male Glamour, as Style and Substance

docs.abstract: In “Vintage Black Glamour: Gentlemen’s Quarters,” Nichelle Gainer explores how prominent and accomplished black men shaped their image through personal style, taking charge of how they were seen to defy stereotypes.

docs.snippet: From Facebook thumbs up to the battle of stones, a history of hope, fear, despair, anger, pride and elation, the film is the real-time chronicle of the two most exciting weeks in the history of modern Egypt as lived by their protagonists. Since th...

A lawyer seeking a new trial for a former New Hampshire prep school student convicted of sexual assault and using a computer to lure a 15-year-old freshman is challenging the computer charge, saying it was not justified.

headline.print_headline: Lawyer: Computer Charge Improper in School Sex Assault Case
headline.main: Lawyer: Computer Charge Improper in School Sex Assault Case

docs.snippet: Forced to leave their homeland, Syrian migrants live roaming from place to place, hoping to return to the land they fled.

headline.main: After 3 Years in Europe, a Refugee Dreams of Syria

docs.abstract: Forced to leave their homeland, Syrian migrants live roaming from place to place, hoping to return to the land they fled.

docs.snippet: A protester was arrested on Tuesday outside Gov. Mark Dayton’s mansion in St. Paul, where demonstrations have taken place since a police officer fatally shot a black man, Philando Castile, 32, on July 6 in Falcon Heights, Minn.
docs.abstract: Photo of police arresting protester outside governor's mansion in St Paul, where demonstrators gathered in protest of death of Philando Castile, who was fatally shot by police officer during traffic stop.

docs.snippet: Fewer Chileans were living in poverty despite weak economic growth in the world's leading copper producer, the government said on Thursday, noting that 11.7 percent of the population was below the poverty line in 2015 compared to 14.4 percent in 2...

headline.print_headline: Fewer Chileans Living in Poverty Despite Economic Slowdown
headline.main: Fewer Chileans Living in Poverty Despite Economic Slowdown

docs.snippet: A peace activist in Charlotte, North Carolina, has been offering police and protesters free hugs in an attempt to calm three nights of unrest that have engulfed the city in the wake of the fatal shooting of a black man by police.

headline.print_headline: Peace Activist Tries to Calm Charlotte Protests With Free Hugs
headline.main: Peace Activist Tries to Calm Charlotte Protests With Free Hugs

docs.snippet: Two Syrian refugees should get medals for their bravery after capturing a fellow migrant suspected of planning to bomb a Berlin airport, German politicians said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Germans Say 'Hero Refugees' Deserve Medals for Tying Up Suspected Bomber
headline.main: Germans Say 'Hero Refugees' Deserve Medals for Tying Up Suspected Bomber
